alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:38PM PST until January 31 at 1:36AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. Pudding River at Aurora affecting Clackamas and Marion Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tualatin River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 32.0 feet, expect flooding of numerous fields and low-lying farms, along with flooding of a few secondary roads in and around Farmington and Tualatin. Some farmland near the river channel will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM PST Monday the stage was 32.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM PST Monday was 32.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday night and gradually falling for the next several days. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 845 AM PST.
